Richard held out a hand and replied simply, "If you'll build us a spaceport, we'll bring you a spaceline." And the rest is history.

Virgin Galactic's adventure began in 2005, and it was in that same year that our founder, @richardbranson, first met with Governor Bill Richardson. In this early exchange, Richardson said, "If you'll bring us a spaceline, we'll build you a spaceport."

We extend our sincere condolences on the passing of former New Mexico Governor Bill Richardson, and our gratitude for his visionary support of Virgin Galactic in New Mexico. Thank you, Bill.

Feels like many misunderstand the difference between bond holders/stockholders/executives and depositors. No one is arguing to bail out the bank. Equity holders should lose everything. But depositors (who did nothing speculative) can‚Äôt access their $ to make payroll this week. 1/
Approved. ‚úÖ

If regulators do not act quickly, the Silicon Valley Bank collapse will have widespread ramifications for small businesses, start-ups, and nonprofits trying to make payroll ‚Äì as well as on our broader economy.

Some are dancing a jig about SVB b/c they think they‚Äôre owning tech.

They‚Äôre not owning tech. They‚Äôre owning the economy.

These are small/medium businesses, e.g., tech, wineries, payroll processors.

+workers who won‚Äôt get paychecks

This is systemic risk. Feds must fix it now.

The Treasury Department and FDIC must communicate loudly and clearly that depositors will be protected. The investors and executives of SBV should bear risk and lose. But this should not mean that workers go without paychecks on Monday or small businesses collapse.

Treasury Department needs to take all appropriate steps to protect ordinary workers and their paychecks, and to prevent a run on other banks. 

Big investors, CEOs and bank executives are one thing ‚Äî they can take a loss ‚Äî but regular workers across California shouldn‚Äôt suffer.

Silicon Valley Bank‚Äôs shareholders and executives lose it all, as they should. Depositors in good faith, however, should recover and have access to their deposits in order to meet their payrolls, pay their suppliers, and to prevent contagion.
